body.p: There 4 main types cells that secrete substances into the stomach. Try to answer the following questions without referring to the chart “Overview of Stomach Cells”
This type of cell secretes a hormone signaling molecule

response.feedback: Incorrect. Parietal cells secrete HCl which kills microbes and denatures proteins and intrinsic factor which enables vitamin B12 absorption.
Incorrect. Chief cells secrete pepsinogen which when activated breaks down proteins and lipase which breaks down triglycerides.
Correct. G cells are enteroendocrine cells that secrete gastrin.
Incorrect. Gastric epithelial cells maintain the structure of the mucosa.

question.body: A lack of this substance could result in anemia because of a lack of red blood cells.

response.feedback: Correct. Parietal cells secrete intrinsic factor which enables vitamin B12 absorption which is required for red blood cell formation.
Incorrect. Chief cells secrete gastric lipase which breaks down triglycerides.
Incorrect. G cells are enteroendocrine cells that secrete gastrin which controls digestion.
Incorrect. Parietal cells secrete HCl which kills microbes and denatures proteins.

Protein and triglyceride digestion would decrease.

question.body: If the goblet cells stopped their secretions what may happen?

multiple_choice.choice: Red blood cell production would decrease.
The gastric juice would damage the lining of the stomach.
The digestion of proteins would decrease
The regulation of stomach motility would be altered.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Intrinsic factor produced by the parietal factors would affect red blood cell production.
Correct. Without the protective layer of alkaline mucus produced by the goblet cells of the gastric epithelial the acidic gastric juice would damage the stomach.
Incorrect. Chief cells secrete pepsinogen which activates pepsin to digest proteins.
Incorrect. G cells produce gastrin which regulates stomach motility.
